name: The Coordination Hierarchy Theorem

main_theorem.name: Coordination Hierarchy Theorem
main_theorem.statement: For round-constructible f(N) >= log(N): CC[o(f(N))] STRICT_SUBSET CC[O(f(N))]
main_theorem.significance: Coordination is a true computational resource

key_results: No gap in hierarchy (unlike time hierarchy)
Optimal protocols exist and are provably optimal
new_questions: Q97: Natural complete problems for each level?
Q98: Coordination complexity of consensus variants?
comparison: Cleaner than time hierarchy, fills gap in communication complexity
confidence_level: VERY HIGH - Rigorous proof following standard technique
publication_target: FOCS, STOC, or JACM (top theory venues)
